Metadata.defaultDescription: Master Derivatives, Integrals and ODEs with deliberate, interactive practice. Train calculus like an athlete trains their sport.
Metadata.ogDescription: Master Derivatives, Integrals and ODEs with deliberate, interactive practice.

Landing.heroSubtitle: The best way to learn to do math.
Landing.modulesSubtitle: 4 Calculus modules organized from basic to advanced.
Landing.howItWorksSubtitle: Each topic has three study modes, designed to take you from theory to fluency.
Landing.modeLearnDesc: Understand the intuition behind each technique with clear explanations, proofs and step-by-step worked examples.
Landing.modeTrainDesc: Solve problems at your own pace. Check the answer and rate your confidence â€” the system adapts to you.
Landing.modeRecognizeDesc: Given a problem, identify which technique to use. This is the skill that separates knowing the material from passing the exam.
Landing.hallOfFameSubtitle: The students who trained the most on the platform.
Landing.uniBattleSubtitle: Which university solves the most exercises?
Landing.ctaSubtitle: 9 topics unlocked. No credit card required.

About.heroSubtitle: We want you to understand math the way it really is â€” and get fluent at it.
About.whyTitle: Math isn't magic. It's logical arguments.
About.whyDesc: Most courses teach how to use a formula. We explain why it works. When the path of mathematics is respected, everything makes sense â€” because at its core, it's just logical arguments applied to axioms.
About.methodDesc: When you understand why a method works, you don't need to memorize â€” you can reconstruct the tool yourself. In the middle of an exam, when memory fails, understanding doesn't.
About.goalTitle: See the problem, know what to do.
About.goalDesc: Understanding is the foundation â€” but fluency is the goal. No hesitation, no flipping through notes. You recognize the pattern, pick the right tool, and solve. That's what we train you for.
About.ctaTitle: Ready to truly understand â€” and get fluent?

LearnPage.heroTitle: What is a Limit â€” and why does it exist?
LearnPage.epigraph: Before derivatives, before integrals, before everything in Calculus, there is the limit. Without it, nothing works. Let's understand why.
LearnPage.ctaSubtitle: Choose a Limits subtopic to start training.
